org.sensorhub.impl.service.sps

Class SPSService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sensorhub.impl.module.AbstractModule<SPSServiceConfig>
      • org.sensorhub.impl.service.sps.SPSService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventListener, IEventProducer, IModule<SPSServiceConfig>, IServiceModule<SPSServiceConfig>

    public class SPSService
extends AbstractModule<SPSServiceConfig>
implements IServiceModule<SPSServiceConfig>, IEventListener

    Implementation of SensorHub generic SPS service. The service can manage any of the sensors installed on the SensorHub instance and is configured automatically from the information generated by the sensors interfaces.

    Since:
    Jan 15, 2015
    Author:
    Alex Robin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanup()
      Cleans up all ressources used by the module when deleted All persistent resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called
      protected void deploy() 
      void handleEvent(Event<?> e) 
      void requestStart()
      Requests the module to start.
      Implementations of this method may block until the module is started or return immediately while they wait for the proper start conditions.
      When this method returns without error the module state is guaranteed to be ModuleEvent.ModuleState.STARTING
      void setConfiguration(SPSServiceConfig config)
      Sets the module configuration
      void start()
      Starts the module synchronously with the current configuration.
      Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully started or send an exception.
      Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
      init() should always be called before start().
      void stop()
      Stops the module.
      All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
      Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully stopped or send an exception.
      Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
      stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.
      protected void undeploy()

    • Method Detail

      • requestStart

        public void requestStart()
                  throws SensorHubException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Requests the module to start.
        Implementations of this method may block until the module is started or return immediately while they wait for the proper start conditions.
        When this method returns without error the module state is guaranteed to be ModuleEvent.ModuleState.STARTING
        Specified by:
        requestStart in interface IModule<SPSServiceConfig>
        Overrides:
        requestStart in class AbstractModule<SPSServiceConfig>
        Throws:
        SensorHubException - if startup could not be initiated

      • start

        public void start()
           throws SensorHubException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Starts the module synchronously with the current configuration.
        Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully started or send an exception.
        Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
        init() should always be called before start().
        Specified by:
        start in interface IModule<SPSServiceConfig>
        Throws:
        SensorHubException

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Stops the module.
        All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
        Implementations of this method must block until the module is successfully stopped or send an exception.
        Module lifecycle events may not be generated when calling this method directly.
        stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IModule<SPSServiceConfig>
